Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an oval carinated body and an unpierced lug on the left side. The nozzle is lost. The filling-hole is at the rear top. On the upper side, in high relief, is Eros playing the kithara. The base-ring is concave within. Covered with a dark brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q474.bis)
